Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: So do you want to see it or not?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't know. Feel like... Friday night crowds...

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Oh my God, you're like, agoraphobic.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Agoraphobic?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Yeah! You would rather sit on your couch and watch a Phillies game, than go out to a movie with your awesome girlfriend.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Absolutely correct.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Later, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Kev, have a good weekend.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Bye. Ok, so this is what's gonna happen. You're gonna suck it up.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Here we go...

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: ...and we're gonna go to dinner.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok...

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: And then we're gonna go to the movies.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sounds good.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Hey Halpert!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey... [Roy lunges towards Jim]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: ROY!

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: [shrieks]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Roy don't! [Dwight pepper-sprays Roy]

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: [screams in pain] Ahh God!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pam, please call security!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Everyday, for eight years, I have brought pepper spray into this office to protect myself and my fellow employees. And everyday, for eight years, people have laughed at me. Well, who's laughing now? [Dwight blinks and winces in pain from the pepper spray]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No need for consternation, everything is under control.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael, last Friday one of your employees attacked another employee in your office!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It was a crime of passion, Jan, not a disgruntled employee. Everyone here is extremely gruntled.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [sigh] Is Toby there?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No...

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I'm... here, Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Ok, what... what is the situation Toby?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Well, we fired Roy, obviously. And Jim won't press charges against Roy or the company.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Thank God.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah, um, but now apparently Darryl has some issue with his...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, he has been wanting a raise for a couple of months and he's just using this Roy thing as leverage.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: All right, well are you gonna take care of this?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeppers.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: What did I tell you about "yeppers?"

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't... remember.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I told you not to say it. Do you remember that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeesh...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I really don't want to talk about it. I don't mean to be rude, but I just... I don't want to comment on what happened. It sucked.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I guess... all things considered, I was lucky Dwight was there. And Roy was lucky that Dwight only used pepper spray. And not the nunchucks or the throwing stars.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey man, I never got a chance to thank you... for stopping Roy. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you not necessary and thus, not accepted. I saw someone breaking the law and I interceded.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. Um... Got you something.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Don't want it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You don't know what it is.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Don't want it. Won't open it. Don't need it. Won't take it. Citizens do not accept prizes for being citizens.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It was a little glass display case for his for his bobblehead. That would have made us even, I think. He saves my life, I get him a box for his desk toy. Even Steven.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, don't call me a hero. Do you know who the real heroes are? The guys who wake up every morning, and go into their normal jobs, and get a distress call from the commissioner, and take off their glasses and change into capes and fly around fighting crime. Those are the real heroes.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Angela, Roy's check. He's coming in later to pick it up.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Man, I cannot believe I missed the fight.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It was crazy.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You saw it? Describe it please.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Well, I heard some shouting. And I look over and Roy's by reception and you could just tell he's gonna punch somebody. Jim says something. Roy stomps over there. All of the sudden, BAM. Roy goes down, and Dwight's standing there like an action hero.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It was insane!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [flustered] Well... good for Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok I want you to be Darryl and ask me for a raise, because I want to try out some of these negotiation tactics on you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Where'd you get that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wikipedia.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wikipedia... is the best thing ever. Anyone in the world can write anything they want about any subject, so you know you are getting the best possible information.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, Darryl, ask me for a raise.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, Mike. Since Roy left I've been doing a lot more work, and I need a raise.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hmm, well that's interesting Darryl. I think... [mumbling softly] that maybe you should... [mumbling jibberish]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I can't hear you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What I'm saying is that, [continues to mumble jibberish]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Still nothin'.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, see what I did?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: By leaning back, and by whispering, I established a dominant physical position.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nice.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, let's try another one. Um...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Walking out of the room unexpectedly.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And what happens in this one?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's a surprise.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Go ahead, ask me for a raise.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Can I have a raise?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [gets up and begins to walk out of the room]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [softly] Sex, Steve Martin, Terri Hatcher.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, what did you say?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I didn't say anything. I was waiting to see what happened.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh it... sounded interesting... what you were gonna...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I saw the perpetrator advance toward the victim at a high rate of speed. His head was thrown back, his shoulder and arm cocked indicating an attack position. Perp grabbed the victim. I removed my weapon from its secure hiding place.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Which is where?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Irrelevant. Discharged it at a distance of a little over a meter into the perpetrator's eyes, nose, and face area. Rendering him utterly and completely disabled. Then I contacted the authorities. The end.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Thanks Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: That is the bravest thing I have ever heard.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I can't imagine what I would have done.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I can. You would have left me to fend for myself. Like that time we were on the Ferris Wheel and that kid dropped a milk shake on me and you just laughed.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Well that was funny, that's why.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh it was?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Okay, well the next time that you get scared, that you think a murderer's in your apartment in the middle of the night...

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: ...and you call me, to calm you down...

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You know what? I didn't--

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Can you stop...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: ...you can just call somebody else 'cause I'm not gonna do it anymore, Ryan. I'm not.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: There's a bunch of people back here, maybe...

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Well, don't talk to me about calling people in the middle of the night...

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Guys...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I call you in the middle of the night to tell you that I love you!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I don't think Michael intended to punish me, by putting Ryan back here with Kelly. But, if he did intend that? Wow. Genius.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [knock on door] Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You ready for me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, yeah, absolutely. Have a seat.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Cool.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what? Actually, let's go into the conference room.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, you know what? Let's stay here. No let's go... Yeah let's go to the conference room.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Tactic number six. Change the location of the meeting at the last second. Totally throws 'em off.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Number 14, declining to speak first. Makes them feel uncomfortable, puts you in control.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [long pause] I am declining to speak first.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Okay, I'll start. It's pretty simple really. I uh, I think I deserve a raise. I'm scheduled to get one in six months, but I'd like that to be moved up to now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hmm. Ohh, Darryl. You are a good worker, and a good man. I just, you know, times are tight. And I just don't think corporate is going to go for this right now.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Are you wearin' lady clothes?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Are you wearin' lady clothes? Those look like lady... pants.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, this is a power suit.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: That there's a woman's suit.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Darryl laughs] I do not buy woman's clothes. I would not make that mistake again.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I'ma call Roy, man.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ohh... kay.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: This is gonna make him feel better.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: This is too good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright, you know what? Pam, could you please tell Darryl that this is not a woman's suit?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh my God, that's a woman's suit!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: You're wearing a woman's suit?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I do, I, I wear men's suits, OK? I got this out of a bin.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There were these huge bins of clothes, and everybody was rifling through them like crazy, and I grabbed one. And it fit! So I don't think that this is totally just a woman's suit. At the very least it's bisexual.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Who makes it?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, [reading the inside of his jacket] MISSterious. And it is mysterious because the buttons are on the wrong side... that's the mystery.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Look, it's got shoulderpads, and did you see that lining?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Did you see...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Would you stop it, please?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So, none of that tipped you off?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's European, OK? It's a European cut.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael, the pants don't have any pockets.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, they don't. See? [Michael lifts his jacket tail, sticks out his back side and shows Pam]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [Laughing, covering her mouth]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Italians don't wear pockets.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's been a really rough couple of days... This helps a little.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Hey, maybe you want to come over and raid my closet?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I don't want to do that because I'm twice your size anyway.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah, he look like Hillary Clinton.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um, let's just do this in 15 minutes.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Okay, can you just stand right there? [snaps camera phone picture] I gotta send some e-mails.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Negotiations are all about controlling things. About being in the driver's seat. And make one tiny mistake, you're dead. I made one tiny mistake. I wore woman's clothes.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Karen, how do you feel that Roy tried to kick your boyfriend's ass over another woman?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: I feel great, Kevin. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: You must have been scared out of your mind.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Well, you know it happened so fast I didn't really have time to be scared.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What happened, exactly? I wasn't here, so I haven't really heard the whole story.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Um, well, Jim and I were talking and Roy walked in looking super angry.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: And he's a big dude, you know? And all of a sudden, Jim pushed me out of the way, and Roy cocked his fist, and then bam, Dwight sprays him and knocks him on his butt.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [flustered] Goodness.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: When I heard Jim and Pam had kissed, my reaction was to have lots of long talks with Jim about our feelings. Roy just attacked him. I'm not sure which one Jim hated more.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Let's get down to business. Why don't you tell me why you think you deserve a raise.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Well, it's simple Mike. I mean we merged these two branches right? So now we're shipping twice as many orders as we used to. With Roy gone we got a smaller crew. And I'm pickin' up all of his slack, so I think I should be compensated fairly, by gettin' a raise.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [mumbles jibberish]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: What? I can't hear you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [mumbling softly] That was a very good point.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I can't-- what, Mike? Are you--

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [mumbling softly] You make a very compelling argument.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sorry I almost got you killed.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, that was nuts.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: He could have broken your nose or something. Crazy. It's just so stupid. I mean, getting back with Roy and everything. I mean, what was I thinking, right?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, I mean, you guys really seem to have a strong connection.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Not anymore. It's, um... It's completely over now.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We'll see. I'm sure you guys will... find you way back to one another someday.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jim... I am really... sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah. Don't worry about it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am going to give you a piece of paper. I want you to write down how much you want, and I want you to slide it back across the desk to me.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Why can't I just... tell you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Because, that is the way these things are done. In... films. [Darryl writes the amount and starts to hand the paper to Michael] No, slide-- slide it, yes.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: There you go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh. [scoffs] Come on. Be serious.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I am serious, Mike. That's a 10% raise. That's what I want.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I... I can't give you that, I-- I don't make this much.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Come on, be for real Mike.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't. Want me to prove it to you? There is... a pay stub.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [laughs] Are you serious? You're earning this?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Plus perks, yes.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Mike, this is barely more than I make. You been here ten years, dog. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Fourteen years.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Ho-ho!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, please, please...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Oh, I'm sorry Mike, some of my folks got to hear about this one. [texting on cell phone] Ah. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, let's take 15, again.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: A boss's salary isn't just about money, it is about perks. It... for example, every year I get a $100 gas card... Can't put a price tag on that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok, if you don't want a gift, at least let me buy you a beer, or lunch or something.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: When Han Solo returns to the Death Star in the Millennium Falcon, and shoots down the TIE fighters and saves the Rebel cause, do you think he does so for a free beer?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Boy I--

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No. And why are you so interested in buying me something Jim, what's your angle?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's like when he annoys me and I want to screw with him to get him back, he never sees it coming. But now, I want to be nice to him, and actually give him something, and he's like an eel. I just can't grab onto him. It's infuriating.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Maybe you just feel guilty about all the pranks.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well... yes, that's probably what it is. So what do I do?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Hmm... I don't know. Maybe you should go back out there and sell paper so we can go on a trip.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Michael, here's the, uh, $15 I owe you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah. I heard you might need it. So...

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Here's the $40 you gave me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I didn't give you $40.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: In a way you did.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Yeah, I heard how much Michael makes. I still think he's way overpaid.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [on cell phone] Fourteen years. Fourteen. I know. [laughing] Ok, alright. I gotta go. Later. [hangs up]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Okay, here's the straight... dope. No tricks. No Wikipedia.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I talked to corporate, and they told me that I can only give you a 5% raise.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: That's 'cause of you, Mike. They're not gonna give the workin' man more than the boss.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well what am I supposed to do?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Get your own raise. You gotta get out there and earn, son.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm not gonna go out and ask for a raise right now. That is ridiculous.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Well, when they merged the two branches together, they put you in charge. Okay, and we're shippin' more now than we ever have.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [exhales] That's true.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah that's true. You gotta call your girl, and get paid. Show her who wears the pants in the relationship.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what? I should.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah, you should.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have been a loyal employee for a long time.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Fourteen years long.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what? I deserve a bump.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Make it happen, cap'in.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am makin' it happen, sergeant.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I remember it was very late at night, like 11, 11:30. Big fella comes in screamin' about God knows what. I think maybe Halpert had stolen his car. [Angela rolls her eyes] Something like that. So the big fella pulls out a sock filled with nickels. Then Schrute grabs a can of hairspray and a lighter--

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You're useless.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Why don't we talk next month, after the quarter ends?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, Jan. I've never asked for a raise in 14 years. This is long overdue. I wanna do it today.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Today. All right, well, uh, if you want to do it today, we should meet in person, and uh, can you get here by five?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yshhyah. Um, yeah. I'll leave right away.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Great. Uh, and listen. Because of our, uh, our... you know, situation, we're gonna need to have a third party present.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, I'm bringing Darryl.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Da-- Darryl from the warehouse?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mm-hm.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: No, Michael. We, we need an HR rep. So, uh, I think you should just bring Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, I'd rather kill myself.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael, he's your branch's HR rep...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [talking over Jan] No, Toby is terrible. Toby is the worst human being I've ever known.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: ...and we need someone else, in the room, because of our relationship. You know this. Michael, either Toby comes with you, or we don't do it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sighs] Fine.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: You are so mean.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I don't know what you're talking about.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yes you do, Ryan Bailey Howard. You called me stupid.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No, I said your idea was stupid.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Toby, come on. Let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Where?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Where? I'm gonna smack you in the head with a hammer. Come on, let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: What is so stupid about wanting to name a baby Usher?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Usher Jennifer Hudson Kapoor.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Don't you see why that's insane?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh, so I'm crazy now?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Comfortable, Mike?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. Fine.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: How about you, man. Comfortable?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [imitating Chris Tucker] Don't ever touch a black man's radio! ...Chris Tucker. Rush Hour. I won't touch yours, by the way.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I haven't been to New York in a long time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mm, the Big Apple.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Maybe I'll stay overnight. Got a cousin lives down there.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: How would we get home?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Oh you could stay too. He's got a big place.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Maybe I'll stay.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Mm, it's not that big.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Busses, though. They get you home quick.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [mouth full of pretzels] Oh, I...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: And all of a sudden, Dwight stood up and was like "No!"

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Then what'd he do? [Kelly's phone rings]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: You should just read the report that Toby did. He took everyone's stories. [answering phone] Dunder Mifflin, customer service, this is Kelly. Oh yeah I could totally help you with that. Ok, let me just get the folder out. Okay, it seems here that you ordered 12,000 reams of paper. Oh, 12 reams...

Quote.Speaker: Hunter
Quote.Text: Hey guys, Jan is ready for you.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Okay, bring it home now. And don't forget the new black man phrase I taught you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pippity poppity, give me the zoppity.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yes sir. Remember that. I'll be right outside if you need me

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah, I taught Mike some new phrases. I want him to get the raise, I... just can't help myself.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: [to Jim] Hey man, uh... I'm sorry. [Jim motions "Don't worry about it"] [Roy receives his check from Angela] Thanks. [to Pam] Can I, like, see you after work for coffee, or... something?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Please. I just got some stuff I gotta say to you. [Pam nods, meekly]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [as Roy is walking out] Jim-- Roy-- Look out!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thanks, Kev. I'm good though.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Thank you, Hunter. [to Michael and Toby] Hello. Come in. [exhales] Ah, Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Who's the boy toy?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: That's my new assistant.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Were you going to tell me that you hired James Van Der Beek?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I have to call you the second I get a new assistant?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Be nice to get a memo, we are lovers.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hi, Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Hi, Toby. [clears throat] First-- [Michael clears his throat] First off, Michael, this is a salary negotiation. All matters regarding our personal relationship have to be set aside. Are we clear?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pippity poppity.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Right now we can offer you a 6% raise.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Six percent? After all we've been through?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Oh, God.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I got you... jade earrings.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael--

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael--

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. You gonna play it like this? You give me a good raise, or no more sex. [Toby begins to write] [to Toby] What are you writing, perv-ball?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Just preparing for the deposition.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: This may be the first time that a male subordinate has attempted to get a modest scheduled raise by threatening to withhold sex from a female superior. It will be a groundbreaking case when it inevitably goes to trial.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: I'm so sorry, Pammy. I really wasn't gonna do anything. But then I... kept thinkin' about you two together, and... I just thought you guys were really good friends, or... or maybe he was gay or somethin'... Not that that's wrong.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm sorry too. I just, I think that we both made some bad choices.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: So you gonna start datin' Halpert then?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um... no. No, he has a girlfriend.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Oh yeah... Wait a minute, you... broke off our wedding for the guy.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, there were a lot of reasons.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: But you're not even gonna try to go out with him? [Pam meekly shakes her head] I don't get you Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I know.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What's this?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What's what?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Certificate of Bravery, from the Scranton Police Department. "Recognizing outstanding citizenship from a very brave young man. Dwight K. Schrute"

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow. I guess word got around. That's a nice... honor.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Please. They hand these out to little kids. Look. There's a teddy bear in a policeman's cap.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [under his breath] Didn't think you'd notice...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why don't you just take that pen and stab me in the heart. This is me, Jan. This is me!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Okay, Michael. Please, why don't we just take a break. This is really going nowhere.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, no, no, no, no. You do not try tactic number eight on me. I invented tactic number eight. I'm not going anywhere.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Ok, Toby, how about if you...

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: What's wrong with you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ohh. It was a weird day. I accidentally cross-dressed. And then Darryl made me feel bad for not making any money. And then I had to ride up here with stupid Toby. And then, your assistant, is all young and hot. And I--

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Okay, Michael. I can offer you a 12% raise, but you have got to ask for 15.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well that's ridiculous I'm not gonna make--

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: No, just... I just need you to ask for it, so I can record that you asked for it. Okay?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah, so... All right, Levinson. Here's the rub. I would like a 15% raise.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: No. But we can offer you 12.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: But you just said 15.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Negotiation is an art. Back and forth. Give and take. And today, both Darryl and I took something. Higher salaries. Win win win. But you know, life is about more... than just salaries. It's about perks. Like having sex with Jan-

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: So you and Bob are looking at a historical house?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm, near the river.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Mm, how many bedrooms?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Four.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Dwight. Dwight. I've been doing some very interesting reading.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm. Tales of bravery.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Mm, good stuff.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm. I was thinking tonight, we could... read it together.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Sounds... fun. [they kiss, Jim walks out of the bathroom and sees]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [scoffs] I... will never say a word. And now, we are even.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I graduated from anger management the same way I graduated from Cornell. On time. Now I'm back. Got a second chance, and I'm not gonna blow it. [in a forceful voice] So look out Dunder Mifflin! [laughs] [snaps] I mean, look out... in a fun way! You know, not like, I'm gonna hurt you...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey guys! Guess who's back! [Dwight pepper-spray's Andy] AHHH! [screams in pain] OH, GOD!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No need to thank me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I am not a hero. I am a mere defender of the office. You know who's a real hero? Hiro, from Heroes. That's a hero. Also, Bono.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Look, I am not a gazillionaire. I can't... I can't dress like Donald Trump dresses. I have to stay within the parameters of my budget. I can't shop at a fancy Norwegian boutique. I buy my suits the old fashioned way. I buy them from discount stores... or on eBay. And when I found out that Ross was having a midnight madness sale, I ran, not walked, as per the instructions on the flier. And I got there, and when the doors opened, all of these women ran to this one bin. And I did too. And I grabbed this suit. And a woman, sort of a, I don't know, Missy Elliot type, grabbed the jacket. And, uh, we had kind of a heated tug of war. And I could tell by the way she was screaming that this must be a get. And I figured she was just buying it for her husband, to answer your question from before. Um, anyway, she s... socked me, in the eye. And she got it, she got the suit. But, I went to the Ross, in Trenton New Jersey, and I found the exact same suit. And I didn't have to deal with Missy Elliot.
